source: iAPX 86/88 User's Manual, Intel 1981, Appendix A
notes: Cycle counts are base clocks. Effective Address (EA) calculation adds additional clocks for memory operands: displacement only=6, BX/BP/SI/DI=5, BP+DI or BX+SI=7, BP+SI or BX+DI=8; add +disp to base+index adds 4 more clocks. Word operands at odd addresses add 4 clocks per access on 8086.

Convert word to doubleword (sign extend AX -> DX:AX)

Repeat load string; 9 base + 13 per iteration

Return near and pop imm16 bytes
Return far and pop imm16 bytes
Jump if below / carry (CF=1). Also JNAE, JC
Jump if not below / no carry (CF=0). Also JAE, JNC
Jump if equal / zero (ZF=1). Also JZ
Jump if not equal / not zero (ZF=0). Also JNZ
Jump if below or equal (CF=1 or ZF=1). Also JNA
Jump if not below or equal (CF=0 and ZF=0). Also JA
Jump if parity even (PF=1). Also JPE
Jump if parity odd (PF=0). Also JPO
Jump if not less (SF=OF). Also JGE
Jump if less or equal (ZF=1 or SF!=OF). Also JNG
Jump if not less or equal (ZF=0 and SF=OF). Also JG
Decrement CX and loop if CX!=0
Loop while zero/equal (CX!=0 and ZF=1). Also LOOPE
Loop while not zero/not equal (CX!=0 and ZF=0). Also LOOPNE
Halt processor until interrupt or reset
Wait for TEST pin active (coprocessor sync)
Assert LOCK# signal prefix (2 clocks overhead)
